alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN CARROLL, WESTERN GRANT, NORTHERN OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Kentucky Speedway, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Warsaw, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Glencoe, Sanders, Sparta, Ethridge, Munk, Ryle, Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 52, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Eagle Hill, Napoleon, Twin Bridges, Eagle Station, Holbrook, Elliston, Carson and Verona. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 50 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
